content.prompt: Which of the following best explains the cycle of reform and repression in the Eastern bloc that persisted throughout the Cold War?

choices.label: Communist leaders sought to improve economic performance and living standards while also maintaining their political authority.
Communist leaders sought to accommodate nationalist and separatist movements within the Eastern bloc.
Soviet authorities sought to strengthen Stalinâ€™s model of economic planning and suppression of dissent.
Soviet authorities sought to prevent mass emigration of minorities out of the Eastern bloc.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
